page.title: 18CRANLEIGH SHOW
page.content: When Oliver Cromwell granted Cranleigh a charter for two 'fayres' a year he can hardly have envisaged the modern day successor _ known to us as the Cranleigh Show. Run by the Cranleigh and South Eastern Agricultural Soceity it is now the Home Counties and Cranleigh Show and attracts entries from a wide area of Surrey, Sussex and Hampshire. There are best of breed classes for all cattle, sheep, pigs, goats and horses. The area international show_jumping trial is held in the arena. There is a rural crafts exhibition, a horticultural show, inter_village W.I. contest, duck_racing, falconry demonstration, vintage traction engines and many more attractions. Previously held in Knowle Park there is now a permanent showground site.
